book.title: Configuration
book.content:
Introduction
Most options on the Settings section should be self explaining.
But I'll try to clarify a few that might not seem logical.

Clearing the browser cache may be needed for changes to appear!

To open the Settings section go to General->Settings inside the administration area.
  • General
  • Display
  • Thumbnails
General

Image Library: Settings it to GD 2 would work in most cases. (jpeg & PNG)
Only use ImageMagick when you know what you're doing. It will be a bit slower but will allow for more file formats to be supported. (jpeg, PNG, gif, tiff and bmp)
Imagemagick Path: Only available when Library is set to ImageMagick, set this to the full path to the convert binary.
e.g. /bin/usr/convert or c:\Program Files\ImageMagick\convert.exe
Image Protection: Enable this to stop people from saving your images, a 1px transparent gif will be saved instead.
Image Cache: Enable this to cache copies of the annotated images, it takes up disk space but image will be transferred.
Image Annotation: Text to be added to an image & the color to be used.
URI Encoding: Switch between encoding modes for URI's.
If images with special characters don't work try using a different setting.
Display

Template: Set the template Imageview uses. Classic & Professional are included.
You can create your own template by using the template framework.
Default Album: Set the default album that is display when Imageview is loaded.
RSS Feeds: Enable this to display the RSS feed link.
Preloading: Set what is preloaded. Interface or Interface & Thumbnails is recommended
Settings this to none has the effect of the UI appearing in chunks and not all at once.
Slideshow Time: Set the interval between images when in slideshow mode.
Thumbnails

Size: Set the size (width x height) of the thumbnails. 100x100 seems to be the standard, Although 150x150 is nice!
Quality: Set the quality of the thumbnails. 75% or above is recommnded.
A lower setting will save some disk space but this is minimal. And the thumbnails won't look too great.
[Note: Changing size or quality requires all thumbnails to be regenerated. You can do so in the Troubleshooting section.]

book.title: User Management
book.content:
Introduction
User management you say? Yes!

To open the User Manager go to General->User Manager inside the administration area.
  • Logout
  • Account Types
  • Creating a User Account
  • Updating a User Account
  • Removing a User Account
Logout
Hold the shift key while pressing the close button will logout out in addition to closing the window.
Account Types
Imageview 6 supports 2 kinds of users.
  1. Administrators
  2. Users
Administrators have full access to all the functions in the administration area,
users only have access to the Album Manager.
Creating a User Account
Inside the User Manager you will be presented with a list of all users on the left side and a form on the left.
The default is New User.

If this is not the case, press the + button underneath the User List.
You will be presented with this form:

Fill in the username and a password. Change the account type if needed. Default is set to User.
Press Create to create the user account.
[Note: Username and password are Case Sensitive!]
[Note: No special characters are allowed here! Space and Underscore should be fine.]
Updating a User Account
Inside the User Manager you will be presented with a list of all users on the left side and a form on the left.
The default is New User.

To update a user account, select it in the User List. The form on the rigth should now look like this:

You can update the password or change the account type. The username field will be disabled.
[Note: When updating your own user account you cannot change the account type!]
Removing a User Account
Inside the User Manager you will be presented with a list of all users on the left side and a form on the left.
The default is New User.

To remove a user account, select it in the User List, pressing the - button will remove the user.
[Note: You cannot remove your own account! You will prompted with the below dialog if you try to do so.]

book.title: Managing Albums
book.content:
Introduction
To open the Manage Albums go to Album Manager->Manage Albums inside the administration area.
  • Creating an Album
  • Updating an Album
  • Removing an Album
Creating an Album
The default form should be the create album form.
If you don't see a create button on the lower right, click the + button at the top.

You will see the create album form:

Name: The name of the album. You can use / to create a group.
e.g. Photography/Landscapes, Vacation 2007, ...
Description: This will be displayed above the thumbnails when viewing and album.
Password: Enter a password or leave blank for none.
Upload: Check this to allow the visitors to upload an image.
[Note: You can use special characters in the name and description fields. HTML can be used in the description field.]
[Note: You can not use a number as a album or group name!]
e.g. 0/Vacation, Vacation/2005,... are wrong!
Updating an Album
Select an Album.

You will see the update album form:

Here you can rename, update the description, set a password or change the upload preferences.
Removing an Album
Select an Album.

Click the - button to remove the album.

book.title: Managing Images
book.content:
Manage Images
To open the Manage Images go to Album Manager->Manage Images inside the administration area.
Select an album.

[Note: Pressing the check button will rebuild the index from the files in the album. - Useful for uploading via FTP]

A list with all image in this album should appear:
[Note: The files are sorted alphabetically on filename (Not the name field!). The order can't be changed!]

Clicking on a row will give you a preview and the ability to delete the image or change its properties.

Name: This will be display underneath the thumbnails. Max 20 characters in length.
Description: This will be display above the image when viewing the image. No length limit.
Display Image When this is disabled the image won't be display. You can enable it again later.
[Note: You can use special characters in the name and description fields. HTML can be used in the description field.]

book.title: Uploading Images
book.content:
Upload Images
To open the Upload Images go to Album Manager->Upload Images inside the administration area.
Select an album and press the + button to add a new upload field.

[Note: You can click the + button multiple times.]

Click the Browse... and select and image. Uploading of this image should now start.

You can cancel the upload by clicking the [x] link near the right side.
Once the the upload of the image is completed the status will be updated.
[Note: The supported filetypes depend on the library used. See Configuration.]


The default name will be the filename without the extention.
You can change the name and add a description in the Manage Images section.
[Note: You can upload multiple images at the same time, although I don't recommend uploading more than 4 at a time.]
